values.name: Raymond Lin
values.why: Growing up with a lack of understanding of my own culture, this club has helped me learn more about my own self-identity and understand the historical and social importance of Chinese traditions and culture
values.fact: I prefer sweet things over salty

values.name: Janice Jiang
values.why: I love the people in CLAID! I love being able to connect with students who share a passion for the Chinese language and culture.
values.hobbies: Watching crime shows, Chinese TikTok, singing

values.name: Alice Li
values.why: I love planning social events and love seeing the community we have built!
values.hobbies: Drinking coffee, playing volleyball, losing in Valorant, and going to the gym!
values.fact: I used to work at Starbucks and a boba shop!

values.name: Amy Chen
values.why: I enjoy hosting events where both Chinese international and Chinese American students can meet and get to know each other!
values.hobbies: Sleep, reading, baking, cooking, hanging out with friends
values.fact: I think monkeys are little demons.

values.name: Talia Zhao
values.why: I like teaching Chinese to other people, and I love the people!
values.fact: I guess you just have to find out after meeting me

values.name: Krystal Liu
values.why: I'm here at CLAID because I enjoy bonding with everyone over Chinese culture, and love the community curated through mutual interest
values.fact: I never put aromatics in my cooking, nor do I ever eat them if it's in my food.

values.name: Jerry Shi
values.why: I wanted to learn more about my cultural heritage
